Jabrill Peppers Might be the Most Jacked NFL Prospect in the Country   How NFL Draft Prospects Use Athos to Improve Their 40-Yard Dash How to Increase Lower-Body Power With Athos How the U.S. Men's Water Polo Team Develops Upper-Body Strength Views 303,307 José Bautista’s Med Ball Series for Hitting Power Views 378,360 Build Baseball Rotational Power With This Med Ball Circuit Views 769,367 Miami Pitcher Tom Koehler's Deadlift Superset Views 139,551 Quick and Easy High-Intensity Burpee Workout Views 139,732 Track Your Training Progress With This High-Intensity Benchmark Workout 3 Core Exercises for High Intensity Athletes Views 112,701 How J.J. Watt Builds a Strong and Durable Upper Body Views 303,990 Previous Next 
Where exactly Michigan Swiss Army Knife Jabrill Peppers will go in the 2017 NFL Draft is up for debate, but there is no question about the man's physical stature. Peppers is listed on Michigan's website as 6-foot-1 and 205 pounds, but in person he's almost certainly closer to 215. His stomach boasts an 8-pack. His arms are roughly the size of Arizona. And watching Peppers as he prepares for the NFL Combine next month at EXOS San Diego provides a display of peak human physicality.
